com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.httptest

Class Handlers

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.httptest.Handlers

  • public abstract class Handlers
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory methods for standard Handler implementations.

      Shortcut handlers for simulating a Server-Sent Events stream.

        public Handlers()

    • Method Detail

      • all

        public static Handler all(Handler... handlers)
        Creates a Handler that calls all of the specified handlers in order.

        You can use this to chain together operations like status(int) and header(String, String).

        Parameters:
        handlers - a series of handlers
        Returns:
        a Handler

      • status

        public static Handler status(int status)
        Creates a Handler that sets the HTTP response status.
        Parameters:
        status - the status code
        Returns:
        a Handler

      • header

        public static Handler header(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String value)
        Creates a Handler that sets a response header.
        Parameters:
        name - the header name
        value - the header value
        Returns:
        a Handler

      • addHeader

        public static Handler addHeader(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String value)
        Creates a Handler that adds a response header, without overwriting previous values.
        Parameters:
        name - the header name
        value - the header value
        Returns:
        a Handler

      • body

        public static Handler body(java.lang.String contentType,
                           byte[] body)
        Creates a Handler that sends the specified response body.
        Parameters:
        contentType - response content type
        body - response body (null is equivalent to an empty array)
        Returns:
        a Handler

      • bodyString

        public static Handler bodyString(java.lang.String contentType,
                                 java.lang.String body)
        Creates a Handler that sends the specified response body.

        The response is encoded with UTF-8 by default, but "charset" is not added to the Content-Type.

        Parameters:
        contentType - response content type
        body - response body (may be null)
        Returns:
        a Handler

      • bodyString

        public static Handler bodyString(java.lang.String contentType,
                                 java.lang.String body,
                                 java.nio.charset.Charset encoding)
        Creates a Handler that sends the specified response body.

        If specified, the encoding's name is added to the Content-Type as the "charset".

        Parameters:
        contentType - response content type
        body - response body (may be null)
        encoding - character encoding; if null, UTF-8 will be used
        Returns:
        a Handler

      • bodyJson

        public static Handler bodyJson(java.lang.String json)
        Creates a Handler that sends a response body with JSON content type.
        Parameters:
        json - the JSON data
        Returns:
        a Handler

      • bodyJson

        public static Handler bodyJson(java.lang.String json,
                               java.nio.charset.Charset encoding)
        Creates a Handler that sends a response body with JSON content type.
        Parameters:
        json - the JSON data
        encoding - character encoding; if null, UTF-8 will be used
        Returns:
        a Handler

      • startChunks

        public static Handler startChunks(java.lang.String contentType,
                                  java.nio.charset.Charset encoding)
        Creates a Handler that starts writing a chunked response. 
        
 Handler handler = Handlers.all(
     Handlers.startChunks("text/my-stream-data"),
     Handlers.writeChunkString("data1"),
     Handlers.writeChunkString("data2")
 );
        Parameters:
        contentType - the content type
        encoding - character encoding to include in the Content-Type header, if any
        Returns:
        a Handler

      • writeChunk

        public static Handler writeChunk(byte[] data)
        Creates a Handler that writes response data in a chunked response.
        Parameters:
        data - the chunk data
        Returns:
        a Handler

      • writeChunkString

        public static Handler writeChunkString(java.lang.String data)
        Creates a Handler that writes response data in a chunked response.

        This always uses the default character encoding to conver the string to bytes. To use a different encoding, do the conversion yourself and call writeChunk(byte[]).

        Parameters:
        data - the chunk data
        Returns:
        a Handler

      • delay

        public static Handler delay(long delayMillis)
        Creates a Handler that sleeps for the specified amount of time.
        Parameters:
        delayMillis - how long to delay, in milliseconds
        Returns:
        a Handler

      • waitFor

        public static Handler waitFor(java.util.concurrent.Semaphore semaphore)
        Creates a Handler that waits until the specified semaphore is available. This can be used to synchronize test logic so that the HTTP response does not proceed until signaled to by the test.
        Parameters:
        semaphore - the semaphore to wait on
        Returns:
        a Handler

      • hang

        public static Handler hang()
        Creates a Handler that sleeps indefinitely, holding the connection open, until the server is closed.
        Returns:
        a Handler

      • sequential

        public static Handler sequential(Handler... handlers)
        Creates a stateful Handler that delegates to each of the specified handlers in sequence as each request is received.

        Any requests that happen after the last handler in the list has been used will receive a 500 error.

        Parameters:
        handlers - a series of handlers
        Returns:
        a Handler
